value.name: Dramatic bodycam footage captures scene of man who murdered three and set his house ablaze
value.description: A police body cam captured the moment officers in Baltimore shot dead a man suspected of setting a house on fire before shooting dead three people

value.name: Police release body worn camera footage from Woodlawn active shooting
value.description: Baltimore County police released body-worn camera video Friday morning of the incident from May 8 where police officers responded to Maury Road in Woodlawn for reports of an active shooter.

value.name: Baltimore County Police Investigating All Calls Involving Everton Brown As More Than $40K Raised For Victims
value.description: Online fundraisers for victims of the explosion and shooting Saturday in Woodlawn have now raised more than $40,000 combined. Baltimore County Police Chief Melissa Hyatt said Everton Brown likely suffered from a mental illness and officers were looking at interactions with him over the past 30 years.

value.name: Mental health law is flawed, critics say after shooting that left three dead
value.description: Everton Brown had called police more than 100 times over 24 years. His neighbors called police about him, too.

value.name: Baltimore County police video shows officers shoot and kill man suspected of triple killing as flames billow nearby
value.description: Body camera footage and a 911 emergency call is released by County police after a gunman killed three people and injured one.

value.name: Baltimore Co. police release bodycam footage from triple murder-officer involved shooting
value.description: WBAL NewsRadio 1090/FM 101.5 - Baltimore County Police have released 911 dispatcher calls and bodycam footage of the May 8 triple murder and fatal officer-involved shooting of 56-year-old Everton Brown.

value.name: ‘Bewildering’: Neighbors say a peace order, calls to cops did nothing to curb Woodlawn man who went on killing spree Saturday

value.name: Police release frantic 911 calls, officer body cam footage of Woodlawn triple murder and fire
value.description: Baltimore County Police on Friday released nearly 30 minutes of frantic 911 calls and officer body worn camera footage from a mass shooting and fire that left four people including the gunman dead in Woodlawn.

video.name: Police release frantic 911 calls, officer body cam footage of Woodlawn triple murder and fire

value.name: Baltimore Career Criminal Sentenced To Life In Prison For Killing Federal Witness
value.description: Davon Carter, 40, was sentenced to 4 life sentences in federal prison for two counts of conspiracy to murder a witness and one count each of witness retaliation murder and witness tampering.

video.name: Baltimore Career Criminal Sentenced To Life In Prison For Killing Federal Witness

value.name: VIDEO: Triple Homicide Suspect Killed In Fiery Gunfight With Police
value.description: Woodlawn, MD – Baltimore County police have released bodycam footage of a fiery shootout between officers and a gunman accused of murdering three people (video below).
